name: Introduction to Engineering
description: Introduces students to the fundamentals of engineering, including the engineering design process and use of computer-aided design tools.

name: Engineering Mathematics
description: Introduces students to the mathematical foundations needed to understand engineering problems. Covers calculus, linear algebra, and differential equations.

name: Physics for Engineering
description: Explores mechanics, thermodynamics, electricity, and magnetism as they apply to engineering.

name: Engineering Statistics
description: Introduces students to the principles and methods of statistical analysis used in engineering.

name: Engineering Design
description: Explores the design process and examines the design of components and systems.

name: Transportation Engineering Basics
description: Introduces students to the fundamentals of transportation engineering, including traffic flow theory, transportation infrastructure, and design principles.

name: Highway Engineering
description: Examines the engineering principles involved in the design and operation of highways, including geometric layout, traffic control systems, and pavement design.

name: Transportation Planning
description: Explores the principles and practice of transportation planning, including travel demand forecasting, trip generation, and the evaluation of alternative transportation systems.

name: Transportation Systems Analysis
description: Introduces students to the tools and techniques used to analyze transportation systems, including network analysis, optimization models, and simulation models.
